nodes.name: Sticky Note9

parameters.content:
=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================

Scrape Glassdoor Job Listings For Prospecting with Bright Data and LLMS

For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
   - LinkedIn: {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
=======================================
Bright Data Docs: {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}


*Important*
Make Sure To Add Your API Keys to the HTTTP REQUESTS NODES (BRIGHT DATA API), GOOGLE RELATED NODES AND LLM NODE

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
üîç Glassdoor Jobs Scraper¬†‚Äì¬†Parameter Guide
Use this object to query Glassdoor jobs.
Each field filters results appropriately.


{
  "location": "{{ $json.Location }}",
  "keyword": "{{ $json.Keyword }}",
  "country": "{{ $json.Country }}"
}
üßæ Field Explanations¬†&¬†Valid Options
üó∫Ô∏è location
City or region for the jobs.
‚úÖ Example: "Berlin", "New¬†York"

üß† keyword
Job title or keyword to match.
‚úÖ Example: "Data¬†Scientist", "Marketing¬†Manager"

üåç country
ISO two‚Äëletter country code.
Use two letters like US,¬†FR.

‚úÖ Full Example
{
  "location": "Berlin",
  "keyword": "Data Scientist",
  "country": "DE"
}

This HTTP Request sends a POST call to Bright Data to start a new dataset snapshot based on your filters.

nodes.name: Basic LLM Chain

parameters.text:
=Read these fields from the job post:
- Company: `{{ $json.company_name }}`
- Title: `{{ $json.job_title }}`
- Description: `{{ $('Google Sheets - Adding All Job Posts').item.json.job_overview }}`

**Task**  
1. If this role relates to marketing, content creation, or audience engagement, write **1‚Äì2 concise icebreaker sentences** that:
   - Reference the company or job context  
   - Explain how our Content Repurposing service can help
Make sure to add the compnay name and job title.

Note that we're not pitching based on the job title.
Were pitching to the organization only if the job position they are looking for, can be fulfilled by our agency.

Example:
Hey,
I've noticed your'e looking for {{ $('Google Sheets - Adding All Job Posts').item.json.job_title }}.

I have an offer that might be relevant to your team.

Then transition to our offer of content repurpose
2. Otherwise, reply with:  
---JOB POST NOT RELEVANT---

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Stickynote Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Stickynote Workflow. This workflow integrates 10 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, formTrigger, wait, splitOut. It contains 25 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 25
- **Node Types**: 10
- **Error Handling**: ‚úÖ Implemented
- **Security**: ‚úÖ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ‚úÖ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Sticky Note9**: stickyNote
- **Snapshot Progress**: httpRequest
- **Sticky Note10**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **On form submission - Discover Jobs**: formTrigger
- **HTTP Request- Post API call to Bright Data**: httpRequest
- **Wait - Polling Bright Data**: wait
- **If - Checking status of Snapshot - if data is ready or not**: if
- **HTTP Request - Getting data from Bright Data**: httpRequest
- **Google Sheets - Adding All Job Posts**: googleSheets
- ... and 15 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
